div.p: Group 1 Mapping from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/TriggerDefinition|5.0.0 to unspecified code system

tr.td: FHIR R5 ComplexType `TriggerDefinition` is representable via FHIR R4 extensions. Element `TriggerDefinition` is mapped to FHIR R4 element `TriggerDefinition`.
Element `TriggerDefinition.type` is mapped to FHIR R4 element `TriggerDefinition.type`.
Element `TriggerDefinition.name` is mapped to FHIR R4 element `TriggerDefinition.name`.
Element `TriggerDefinition.code` is will have a context of TriggerDefinition based on following the parent source element upwards and mapping to `TriggerDefinition`.

Note that there is an externally-defined extension that has been flagged as the representation of FHIR R5 element `TriggerDefinition.subscriptionTopic` with an unmapped Canonical type: `http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/alternate-canonical`. Element `TriggerDefinition.subscriptionTopic` is will have a context of TriggerDefinition based on following the parent source element upwards and mapping to `TriggerDefinition`.

Note that the target element context `TriggerDefinition.timing[x]` is a choice-type element and cannot directly hold extensions. The context is moved up to parent element `TriggerDefinition`. Element `TriggerDefinition.timing[x]` is mapped to FHIR R4 element `TriggerDefinition.timing[x]`. Note that the target element context `TriggerDefinition.timing[x]` is a choice-type element and cannot directly hold extensions. The context is moved up to parent element `TriggerDefinition`.
Element `TriggerDefinition.data` is mapped to FHIR R4 element `TriggerDefinition.data`.
Element `TriggerDefinition.condition` is mapped to FHIR R4 element `TriggerDefinition.condition`.

title.value: Cross-version ConceptMap for FHIR R5 resources in FHIR R4

description.value: This ConceptMap represents the cross-version mapping of resource FHIR R5 for use in FHIR R4.

comment.value: FHIR R5 ComplexType `TriggerDefinition` is representable via FHIR R4 extensions. Element `TriggerDefinition` is mapped to FHIR R4 element `TriggerDefinition`.

Element `TriggerDefinition.subscriptionTopic` is will have a context of TriggerDefinition based on following the parent source element upwards and mapping to `TriggerDefinition`.

Note that the target element context `TriggerDefinition.timing[x]` is a choice-type element and cannot directly hold extensions. The context is moved up to parent element `TriggerDefinition`. Element `TriggerDefinition.timing[x]` is mapped to FHIR R4 element `TriggerDefinition.timing[x]`. Note that the target element context `TriggerDefinition.timing[x]` is a choice-type element and cannot directly hold extensions. The context is moved up to parent element `TriggerDefinition`.
